definition: to incorporate into one's troops/to weave in
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to weave/to plait/to organize/to group/to arrange/to edit/to compile/to write/to compose/to fabricate

sentences.english: Second, it is utilized, at times, as a decoy for incorporating the opposition.
sentences.chinese: 其次，政府有时以补助做为收编反对势力的诱饵。

sentences.english: That has to involve a cleaning up of the Afghan National Police service, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 收编的过程必须包括彻底清理阿富汗国家警察。

sentences.english: Public and private laws are contained in separate volumes.
sentences.chinese: 公法和私法被分卷收编。

sentences.english: Some volumes arrange thematically the works of different authors.
sentences.chinese: 一些图书按主题收编不同作者的作品。

definition: to rely on help from sb
to encircle and annihilate/refers to repeated campaigns of the Guomindang against the communists from 1930 onwards
to surrender and pay allegiance to
to instigate (rebellion etc)/incitement (e.g. to desertion within opposing camp)
to include (in a list etc)/to assign (to a class, a work unit etc)
to realign one's allegiance (to another religion, ruler etc)/to submit
to subdue/to force to capitulate/to reduce to submission/to soothe
